verses.roman:
tri-bhuvana bhari' uṭhe kīrtanera dhvani
anya vādyādira dhvani kichui nā śuni

synonyms: tri-bhuvana bhari'-filling the three worlds; uṭhe—arose; kīrtanera dhvani—vibration of saṅkīrtana; anya—other; vādya-ādira—of musical instruments; dhvani—the sound; kichui—anything; nā—not; śuni—hears.
translation: When the saṅkīrtana resounded, it filled the three worlds. Indeed, no one could hear mundane sounds or musical instruments other than the saṅkīrtana.
